result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 2 and 4.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty.

9:04 AM Defendant Eric J DeBrow in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Eric J DeBrow.  Attorney Trisha Simmons for Patrick Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. *TAKEN INTO CUSTODY*

  Cash bond is set in the amount of $5000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
